critique: This document is an executive order amending Civil Service Rules related to the Bureau of Prisons and the Board of Parole. It removes some subdivisions related to the appointment of officials. Given the limited scope and focus on internal administrative matters, the document does not directly address broader ideological issues, immigration, or economic regulation. It has a neutral impact on executive power and federalism. The changes seem to be related to internal organization and do not obviously prioritize either national security or civil liberties. Similarly, the document does not seem to promote or hinder social inclusion or diversity. Therefore, most scores should be close to zero.
